div.p: PEARNINGS is conceptually related to WRITING PRODUCTION . It comments both on the value/amount of her literary earnings and her attitude towards them. This means earnings, direct or indirect, from writing, not from a day job (which is to be tagged as REMUNERATION, in OCCUPATION, in the BIOGRAPHHY section). It also sometimes encloses comment on a writer’s feelings or statements about her earnings. It is often used with PCONTRACT or other tags relating to publication process. It should enclose more than just a figure: a sentence-length statement of her revenue derived from writing, which can be a numeric or text-based and includes intangible or unspecified earnings (favours granted, other types of exchanges or barters.) If using a numeric value, remember to insert an entity for the pound sign: ¥

div.codeblock: <PEARNINGS>Letters from the Mountains brought Ann Grant what she considered real wealth.</PEARNINGS>

<PEARNINGS>Hannah More had made over ¥30,000 from her publications.</PEARNINGS> <PEARNINGS>The proceeds from Elizabeth Grant's early periodical publications allegedly saved the family from financial ruin.</PEARNINGS>
